revised_title: Sir John Lubbock's Contributions to the Origin of Species
tldr: This article discusses the contributions of Sir John Lubbock to Charles Darwin's theory of evolution and the development of the "Origin of Species." Lubbock, a prominent scientist in Victorian England, provided important evidence, observations, and suggestions to Darwin, and was a close friend and neighbor. His work on various species and his support for natural selection helped strengthen Darwin's theory.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
